chapter.title: Building MailFlux
chapter.para: This chapter describes how to build MailFlux and associated documentation. Currently the tools used to create this application are as listed below. The version numbers given are for the versions used by the MailFlux developers. Other versions of each tool may also work. In addition, tools from other vendors may work although some of the build scripts and configuration files would likely need to be updated first. This document does not describe how to install these tools; consult the corresponding documentation for each tool for that tool's installation instructions.

listitem.para: GNAT GPL 2014. Certain GNAT extensions (mostly GNAT specific library packages and GNAT's support for SPARK) are used. Currently no other Ada compiler is supported.
Xalan v2.6.0. This is a Java program. The latest version can be downloaded from the Apache Project site at . In order to execute Xalan you will also need a suitable Java runtime system installed.

FOP v0.20.5. This is also a Java program. The latest version can be downloaded from the Apache Project site at . As with Xalan you will also need a suitable Java runtime system installed in order to execute FOP. Note that the current version of FOP is unfinished and it produces a number of errors when used with the stylesheets below. These errors can be ignored. The resulting document is servicable regardless.

chapter.para: If you are not interested in rebuilding the documentation you do not need to read any further in this chapter.
